page.title: 10TRANSPORT IN SHALBOURNE AREA
page.content: 7 out of 8 householders are car owners and 1 in 8 has more than one. A few of the young use mopeds and motorcycles; a handful of all ages ride a bicycle or walk within the village where there is also a car hire service. A private company from outside the area provides twice weekly return{bus service}to both Hungerford and Newbury; however it is little used: even those with no car usually have access to one and there are no discretionary fares; it is doubtful if buses would survive were they not used for{schools {transport:}in term time a few children are bussed daily to the village primary school and most older ones taken to/from the Comprehensive in Marlborough.{Trains}run from Bedwyn to London and the West Country but there are no buses to the station. The{canal at Bedwyn is used only for recreation.
